atst.giss.abplc

Class ABPlcioConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • atst.giss.abplc.ABPlcioConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IABPlcioConnection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ABPlcioConnectionGis

    public abstract class ABPlcioConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements IABPlcioConnection
    This is the GISS abstract connection class from which all GISS controller specific connection classes are derived.

    This class contains the none controller specific connection behavior required by all GISS controller connection's to communicate with the GIS PLC.

    • Method Detail

      • isSimulated

        public boolean isSimulated()
        Returns the current simulation status of the connection.

        The connection simulation state is set by connect(String[]) from the Property DB attribute PROPERTY_CONNECTION_SIM. When simulation is true the connection is connected to the VGIS simulator and not the real GIS PLC.

        Returns:
        true if this connection is not connected to real GIS PLC hardware.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String[] addresses)
             throws ConnectionException
        Called by CSF when controller receives startup command. Opens first connection to GIS PLC using address passed as parameter if connection is not in simulation.

        Sequence of operations carried out by this method:

        1. Read from propertyDB this connection's isSimulated status (.connection:isSimulated). Only if isSimulated=false does the connection connect to the real GIS PLC, otherwise the VGIS simulator is used.
        2. If log category ABPLCIO_CONNECTION_PLCIO is greater than 0 (zero) signal to PLCIO to log debug messages in file /var/tmp/plcio.log.
        3. Obtain list of all PLC tags used by this connection's controller from the propertyDB. Property attribute name declared in IPlcTag#PROPERTY_TAG_LIST. If no such property exists for controller then a ConnectionException is thrown.
        4. A PlcTag#PlcTag(String) object is created for each tag contained in the tag list. Tag objects are destroyed in disconnect().
        5. For each tag create a ABPlcioChannel#ABPlcioChannel(String) object and add to the IChannel Set returned by this method.
        Parameters:
        addresses - The network address of the GIS PLC obtained by the CSF from the controller's .connection:address propertyDB attribute.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - When any failure occurs from which the connection cannot recover.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Description copied from interface: IABPlcioConnection
        Returns true if-and-only-if one or more connections to the GIS PLC are currently open.

        During the controller's doStartup() the controller calls IABPlcioConnection.startPlcTagReaders() to signal connection to open channel to GIS PLC to read its CStatus tag. In controller's doShutdown() the controller calls IABPlcioConnection.stopPlcTagReaders() which will close the channel used to read the CStatus tag. Therefore while controller is running this method should always return true unless there has been a problem connecting to the GIS PLC.

        Specified by:
        isConnected in interface IABPlcioConnection
        Returns:
        true if one or more connections to the GIS PLC are open, otherwise false.

      • startPlcTagReaders

        public void startPlcTagReaders()
        Description copied from interface: IABPlcioConnection
        Signal the connection to start its PlcTagReader(s).

        Provided to be called when connection's controller receives doStartup().

        Specified by:
        startPlcTagReaders in interface IABPlcioConnection

      • stopPlcTagReaders

        public final void stopPlcTagReaders()
        Description copied from interface: IABPlcioConnection
        Signal the connection to stop its PlcTagReaders.

        Provided to be called when connection's controller receives doShutdown(); to ensure threads started to periodically read PLC tags stop communicating with hardware when shutdown is demanded.

        Specified by:
        stopPlcTagReaders in interface IABPlcioConnection

      • openPlcConnection

        public void openPlcConnection(java.lang.String name)
                       throws ConnectionException
        Description copied from interface: IABPlcioConnection
        Explicitly open a connection to the GIS PLC - used for testing and maintenance/engineering only.

        This method is not the method used during normal operations for opening connections to the GIS PLC, it is only used by controllers when a configuration is submitted containing the attribute .plcConnection:open. The param name will be used as the opened connection's channel name. ABPlcioConnection names the channels it opens using the PLC tag name that will be transferred using the connection, therefore to open a connection that will subsequently be used to read or write a tag call this method with name equal to a valid PLC tag name of the connection's controller.

        Specified by:
        openPlcConnection in interface IABPlcioConnection
        Parameters:
        name - The name the connection will be identified by.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if there is a problem communicating with the hardware

      • closePlcConnection

        public void closePlcConnection(java.lang.String name)
                        throws ConnectionException
        Description copied from interface: IABPlcioConnection
        Explicitly close a connection to the GIS PLC - used for testing and maintenance/engineering only.

        This method is not the method used during normal operations for closing connections to the GIS PLC, it is only used by controllers when a configuration is submitted containing the attribute .plcConnection:close.

        Specified by:
        closePlcConnection in interface IABPlcioConnection
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the connection to be closed.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if there is a problem communicating with the hardware

      • getNextCmdID

        public int getNextCmdID()
        Description copied from interface: IABPlcioConnection
        Get the next Command ID.

        GIS PLC write tags contain the item ID. The current command being acted upon by the GIS is returned to the GISS in the corresponding status read tag. The GISS produces the command ID in a sequence starting at 1 (one) and progressing by increments of 1 until the value 10000 is reached, at which point the ID is reset to value 0 and the sequence restarted.

        Specified by:
        getNextCmdID in interface IABPlcioConnection
        Returns:
        The next Command ID to be used.
